user.description:
Choose which **Smart Vents** you would like to use for these **Areas**.
 
 If you do **NOT** see your **Smart Vent** listed here, be sure the **Smart Vent *Entities* (rather than the *Device*) are explicity assigned to an Area.** 
 Confirm you see them here: **Settings -> Areas & zones -> Area -> Entities**

second.description:
Choose which **Connectivity Sensors** you would like to use for these **Areas**.
 
 If you do **NOT** see your Connectivity Sensors listed here, be sure the **Connectivity Sensor *Entities* (rather than the *Device*) are explicity assigned to an Area.** 
 Confirm you see them here: **Settings -> Areas & zones -> Area -> Entities**. 
 
 **Connectivity Sensors** are used to determine if a **Battery Powered Smart Vent** is awake and ready for commands.

third.description:
Choose which **Temperature Sensors** you would like to use for these **Areas**.
 
 If you do **NOT** see your Temperature Sensor listed here, be sure the **Temperature Sensor *Entities* (rather than the *Device*) are explicity assigned to an Area.** 
 Confirm you see them here: **Settings -> Areas & zones -> Area -> Entities**

fourth.description:
Choose your **Thermostat**.
 
 If you do **NOT** see your Thermostat listed here, be sure the **Thermostat *Entity* (rather than the *Device*) is explicity assigned to an Area.** 
 Confirm you see them here: **Settings -> Areas & zones -> Area -> Entities**

fifth.description:
Choose which rooms are **Bedrooms** and set what time to start and stop **Night Time Mode**.
 
  The goal of this feature is to decrease vent noise while sleeping and to only climate control the **Bedrooms.** At night only **Bedroom** vents will remain open while all other room's vents will remain closed. In addition, the **Thermostat** will change from active to idle (and vice-versa) to meet the **Bedroom's** target temperature. If you do not select any **Bedrooms**, regular vent operation will occur all day and night.

sixth.description:
Do you want to abstract away the **Central Thermostat**?
 
 If you are using this system to control most of or all of your home, we suggest **Yes**; if you are only controlling one or a few **Areas**, we suggest **No**. At the end of this configuration flow we will create one **Virtual Thermostat** per **Area**. If you choose **Yes** you will only control the **Central Thermostat** to adjust the **HVAC Mode** (Heat, Cool, or Off) and this system will control the **Central Thermostat** target temperature based on all the area's target and actual temperatures. If you choose **No** you can use your **Central Thermostat** as normal and this system will only look at the **Central Thermostat** to check **HVAC Mode** because this is one of the inputs needed to determine whether an area has met its target temperature or not.
